Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2014 04:26PM Coblndie wrote: I'm starting this yes. Meeting with the Onco tomorrow to find out my start date
Posts.Title: Herceptin & Perjeta Adjuvant Gretta april25

Posts.Content: Coblndie wrote: I'm having a double mastectomy with direct to implant reconstruction on March 4th. I'm getting pretty nervous over it. I had neoadjuvent care with 6 rounds of chemo I was very strong through. My EKG just came back saying I had a myocardial infarction at some point, so I'm about to go for a stress echo, although no one seems concerned about it not sure why. This surgery is throwing me for a loop...or maybe its the part that I'm almost cancer free. I'm not sure but I've had high anxiety lately....hitting me like a ton of bricks. Any advice or experience that anyone can offer me? This is done all the time, I'm not sure why i'm so nervous about it! Dx 9/5/2014, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Chemotherapy 10/22/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 3/4/2015 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling Nervous Coblndie Novna70

Posts.Content: Coblndie wrote: I started chemo last Wed. I am Pertuzamab, Herceptin, Carbo, Taxo, once every 3 weeks. I am MISERABLE. I can not eat, I can not sleep, I am hot, I am cold, my whole body aches. I dry heave. I am taking my meds, but I just don't feel like I can handle this. This is neoadjuvent care, so at the end of 6 sessions I'll have surgery. My Pet Scan was clear, my lymph nodes were clear, my BRCA was negative. How do you do it. I have a 7 year old. All I can do is weep and feel miserable. Please help me, and pray for me. Dx 9/5/2014, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Chemotherapy 10/22/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 3/4/2015 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Day 5 and I don't feel strong enough Coblndie Coblndie

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2014 10:22AM Coblndie wrote: Thank you all! I did go to the ER and found my WBC had sunk to 1.4 I was critically neutropenic. I got put on antibiotics, and got tons of fluid. I'm feeling better now finally except for severe neuropathy and blurred vision. Right in time for infusion 2 in 2 days. ugh.
Posts.Title: Day 5 and I don't feel strong enough Coblndie Coblndie
